text:
I don't think you need to call `JuMP.register` if you want to use L-BFGS for the Hessians. You should be able to set it with an optimiser attribute:
```model = Model(Ipopt.Optimizer)
set_optimizer_attribute(model, "hessian_approximation", "limited-memory")```

text: Thanks. Don't I need to register a user defined function though to use it in e.g. the objective? My function is a simple simulation on the ~1k variables, and I don't think I can write it using just `@NLexpression`s.

elements.text: Thanks. Don't I need to register a user defined function though to use it in e.g. the objective? My function is a simple simulation on the ~1k variables, and I don't think I can write it using just

text: You do need to register user-defined functions, but I think if you want to use L-BFGS then you should pass `autodiff = false` and set the optimiser attribute as I mentioned in my previous comment. You should be able to verify this with the output from Ipopt during the optimisation if you set it to verbose, right?
